com.google.android.glass.TMM

Class TextCard

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.android.glass.TMM.TMMCard
      • com.google.android.glass.TMM.TextCard
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<TMMCard>

    public class TextCard
extends TMMCard
implements java.io.Serializable
    The Class TextCard. This card contains information representing a single card in the TellMeMore app. This card is used to present context-relevant textual/image information to the user, usually related to what they are learning about at that time.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    atm011
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • TextCard

        public TextCard(int priority,
                java.lang.String cardTitle,
                java.lang.String ic_path,
                Server source)
        Instantiates a new text card, with an icon but without any content.
        Parameters:
        priority - The priority of the card. This is used to order the cards in the SelectCardActivity, with higher priority cards located at the beginning of the sequence (position 0)
        cardTitle - The card's title. This is displayed prominently and is usually the largest text on the card. For best visibility, this should be less than 20 characters long.
        ic_path - The path to the icon image file to use for this card.
        source - Information about the Server that this card originated from.

      • TextCard

        public TextCard(int priority,
                java.lang.String cardTitle,
                Server source)
        Instantiates a new text card. This is the minimal constructor for this card requiring.
        Parameters:
        priority - The priority of the card. This is used to order the cards in the SelectCardActivity, with higher priority cards located at the beginning of the sequence (position 0)
        cardTitle - The card's title. This is displayed prominently and is usually the largest text on the card. For best visibility, this should be less than 20 characters long.
        source - Information about the Server that this card originated from.

      • TextCard

        public TextCard(java.lang.String id,
                int priority,
                java.lang.String cardTitle,
                Server source)
        Instantiates a new text card with an ID obtained for the database.
        Parameters:
        id - The unique UUID of the card. This must be obtained from the DB that the card resides on.
        priority - The priority of the card. This is used to order the cards in the SelectCardActivity, with higher priority cards located at the beginning of the sequence (position 0)
        cardTitle - The card's title. This is displayed prominently and is usually the largest text on the card. For best visibility, this should be less than 20 characters long.
        source - Information about the Server that this card originated from.

      • TextCard

        public TextCard(java.lang.String id,
                int priority,
                java.lang.String cardTitle,
                java.lang.String line1,
                java.lang.String line2,
                java.lang.String line3,
                Server source)
        Instantiates a new text card with no icon or content.
        Parameters:
        id - The unique UUID of the card. This must be obtained from the DB that the card resides on.
        priority - The priority of the card. This is used to order the cards in the SelectCardActivity, with higher priority cards located at the beginning of the sequence (position 0)
        cardTitle - The card's title. This is displayed prominently and is usually the largest text on the card. For best visibility, this should be less than 20 characters long.
        line1 - The top subtitle/summary line of text.
        line2 - The middle subtitle/summary line of text.
        line3 - The bottom subtitle/summary line of text.
        source - Information about the Server that this card originated from.

      • TextCard

        public TextCard(java.lang.String id,
                int priority,
                java.lang.String cardTitle,
                java.lang.String line1,
                java.lang.String line2,
                java.lang.String line3,
                java.util.ArrayList<TextElement> content,
                Server source)
        Instantiates a new text card.
        Parameters:
        id - The unique UUID of the card. This must be obtained from the DB that the card resides on.
        priority - The priority of the card. This is used to order the cards in the SelectCardActivity, with higher priority cards located at the beginning of the sequence (position 0)
        cardTitle - The card's title. This is displayed prominently and is usually the largest text on the card. For best visibility, this should be less than 20 characters long.
        line1 - The top subtitle/summary line of text.
        line2 - The middle subtitle/summary line of text.
        line3 - The bottom subtitle/summary line of text.
        content - The ArrayList of TextElement objects that contain the textual/visual content of the card.
        source - Information about the Server that this card originated from.

      • TextCard

        public TextCard(java.lang.String id,
                int priority,
                java.lang.String cardTitle,
                java.lang.String line1,
                java.lang.String line2,
                java.lang.String line3,
                java.lang.String ic_path,
                java.util.ArrayList<TextElement> content,
                Server source)
        Instantiates a new text card with the most amount of information contained in it upon creation.
        Parameters:
        id - The unique UUID of the card. This must be obtained from the DB that the card resides on.
        priority - The priority of the card. This is used to order the cards in the SelectCardActivity, with higher priority cards located at the beginning of the sequence (position 0)
        cardTitle - The card's title. This is displayed prominently and is usually the largest text on the card. For best visibility, this should be less than 20 characters long.
        line1 - The top subtitle/summary line of text.
        line2 - The middle subtitle/summary line of text.
        line3 - The bottom subtitle/summary line of text.
        ic_path - The path to the icon image file to use for this card.
        content - The ArrayList of TextElement objects that contain the textual/visual content of the card.
        source - Information about the Server that this card originated from.
